mdRecord.dcterms:title: Penshurst Place and Gardens, exterior|general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Sir John de Pountney received the license to crenellate in 1341. The fourteenth century hall remains. A second was issued in 1393. Additions including a larger hall were made in 1430. There were also 16th and 19th additions and remodelings. J.B. Rebecca was responsible for many of the early 19th century alterations; while George Devey was responsible for the remodel of the gardens. -- The Buildings of England Series: West Kent and Weald (1969). [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
